contentObject.content: Petco Health & Wellness Co. Inc. (WOOF) shares rose nearly 5% in Tuesday premarket trading after it swung to a  fourth-quarter profit. Net income totaled $29.0 million, or 11 cents per share, after a loss of $6.2 million, or 3 cents per share, last year. Adjusted EPS of 28 cents beat the FactSet consensus for 25 cents. Revenue of $1.514 billion was up from $1.338 billion last year and ahead of the FactSet consensus for $1.484 billion. Comparable sales growth was 14%, ahead of the FactSet consensus for 11.8% growth. For fiscal 2022, Petco is guiding for fiscal 2022 net revenue of $6.15 billion to $6.25 billion and adjusted EPS of 97 cents to $1. The FactSet consensus is for revenue of $6.088 billion and EPS of 89 cents. Petco stock is down 14.6% over the past year while the S&P 500 index  is up 9.9%.
